title: Politics
description: Post Politics from The Washington Post is the source for political news headlines, in-depth politics coverage and political opinion, plus breaking news on the biden administration and White House, Congress, the Supreme Court, elections and more.

title: Post Politics Now: Biden to mark 100 days since Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade
dc:creator: John Wagner
description: Officials plan to discuss a White House report noting that abortion bans have taken effect in more than a dozen states and close to 30 million women of reproductive age now live in a state with a ban.

title: Christian Walker turns his online influence against his father
dc:creator: Philip Bump
description: The biggest threat to Herschel Walker’s Senate campaign may be his own son.

title: Build a personalized democracy toolkit to get ready for the midterms
dc:creator: Washington Post Staff
description: Just tuning in? Maybe you want a primer on how to vote, who’s on your ballot, or other election basics. We’ve got you covered!

title: What happens next with Herschel Walker
dc:creator: Aaron Blake
description: The Daily Beast reported Walker paid for a girlfriend's abortion in 2009. What will the GOP do, and what could the story mean for Walker's campaign?

title: What are midterm elections and why are they important?
dc:creator: Amber Phillips
description: Who are the candidates I should know about? What are the top issues? How can I vote? We answer your questions about the November elections.

title: The issue choice that could decide the 2022 election
dc:creator: Aaron Blake
description: It seems quite possible the battle for Congress will be decided based upon which timely issues Americans vote on more: the economy and inflation (Republicans), or abortion rights and political extremism (Democrats). But which weighs more heavily?

title: What happens next with Herschel Walker
dc:creator: Aaron Blake
description: The Daily Beast reported Walker paid for a girlfriend's abortion in 2009. What will the GOP do, and what could the story mean for Walker's campaign?

title: Sheryl Sandberg’s next chapter: Pledging millions to fight abortion bans
dc:creator: Elizabeth Dwoskin
description: Sandberg's announcement of her donation to the ACLU to fight abortion bans comes just a few days after she leaves Meta.

title: Herschel Walker denies report that he paid for girlfriend’s abortion
dc:creator: Annie Linskey
description: Walker’s denial came after the Daily Beast published an account from a woman who said Walker encouraged her to have an abortion while they were dating.

title: Abortion is now banned in these states. See where laws have changed.
dc:creator: Caroline Kitchener
description: Thirteen states had "trigger bans" to criminalize abortion when the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. Several other states are working to enact other laws.

title: As gas prices rise, Democrats scramble to lay blame on Big Oil
dc:creator: Evan Halper
description: Fuel costs are up sharply in several states as the midterm elections approach, leading the White House to threaten market interventions and step up rhetoric.

title: Trump sues CNN for defamation, seeks $475 million in damages
dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho
description: Former president Donald Trump has a history of being highly litigious against critics in the media, though these lawsuits have had little success.

title: Laurence Silberman, titan of conservative jurisprudence, dies at 86
dc:creator: Emily Langer
description: The federal appeals court judge was celebrated among conservatives as a constant if sometimes provocative exponent of judicial restraint

title: David Beckwith, who scooped Supreme Court on Roe v. Wade, dies at 79
dc:creator: Harrison Smith
description: After working as a journalist at Time magazine, he became the inaugural editor of the Legal Times in Washington and a spokesman for Dan Quayle.

title: Biden, seeking contrast to Trump, vows $60 million in Puerto Rico visit
dc:creator: Arelis R. Hernández
description: The money aims to shore up levees, strengthen flood walls and create a new flood warning system for the U.S. territory.

title: Trump’s lawyer refused his request in February to say all documents returned
dc:creator: Josh Dawsey
description: After 15 boxes of government records were sent to the National Archives in January, attorney Alex Cannon thought Donald Trump might have more records at Mar-a-Lago, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Federal employee health-care premiums to rise 8.7 percent on average
dc:creator: Eric Yoder
description: Premiums in the health-care program for federal employees and retirees will increase by 8.7 percent on average for 2023 — the largest increase in more than a decade.

title: What are midterm elections and why are they important?
dc:creator: Amber Phillips
description: Who are the candidates I should know about? What are the top issues? How can I vote? We answer your questions about the November elections.

title: After vaccines became available, a partisan gap in deaths emerged
dc:creator: Philip Bump
description: The link between covid deaths and partisanship gets robust reinforcement.

title: Tracking Biden’s nominees to fill the top roles in his administration
dc:creator: Harry Stevens
description: Follow the president's progress filling nearly 800 positions, among the 1,200 that require Senate confirmation, in this tracker from The Washington Post and the Partnership for Public Service.

title: The issue choice that could decide the 2022 election
dc:creator: Aaron Blake
description: It seems quite possible the battle for Congress will be decided based upon which timely issues Americans vote on more: the economy and inflation (Republicans), or abortion rights and political extremism (Democrats). But which weighs more heavily?

title: Post Politics Now: Biden praises Puerto Rico’s resilience, vows to deliver every dollar it was promised
dc:creator: John Wagner
description: Biden to announce more than $60 million in funding to shore up levees, strengthen flood walls and create a new warning system to help Puerto Rico better prepare for storms.

title: New ad shows Louisiana congressional candidate giving birth
dc:creator: John Wagner
description: If you watch until the end of this campaign ad, you’ll see a candidate giving birth.
